title: Fall Protection at Heights Above 6 Feet
description: Reviewed OSHA 1926 Subpart M requirements. Demonstrated proper full-body harness fit adjustment and inspection. Covered anchor point selection for steel erection and curtain wall installation. Discussed self-retracting lifeline vs shock-absorbing lanyard selection.
notes: All Tower C and Resort high-rise crews attended. Distributed new harness inspection pocket cards. 3 harnesses failed inspection and were removed from service.

title: Crane Signal Person Responsibilities
description: Covered standard hand signals per ASME B30.5. Reviewed radio communication protocols for multi-crane lifts. Discussed signal person qualification requirements and daily competency verification. Practiced signals in field exercise.
notes: All crane operators and signal persons attended across all jobsites. Updated signal chart posters at all crane locations. Scheduled requalification for 2 signal persons.

title: Confined Space Entry and Rescue
description: Reviewed OSHA 1926.1203 permit-required confined space procedures. Covered atmospheric testing requirements and monitoring frequency. Demonstrated tripod and winch rescue equipment setup. Practiced emergency extraction scenario.
notes: Critical for Kemp Petrochemical tank work and Port Terminal below-grade utility work. All entrants attendants and rescue team members present. Updated confined space inventory list.

title: Excavation and Trenching Competent Person
description: Covered soil classification using manual testing methods. Reviewed Type A B and C soil protective system requirements. Discussed dewatering effects on soil stability. Field exercise classifying actual site soils.
notes: Hardy Toll Road and Drake Waterfront excavation crews. Competent person designations verified. 2 new employees completed competent person qualification.

title: Electrical Safety and Arc Flash Awareness
description: Detailed review of arc flash incident at Port Terminal substation. Covered approach boundaries and PPE requirements for various voltage levels. Demonstrated proper lockout tagout procedures. Reviewed energized work permit process.
notes: MANDATORY company-wide attendance following recent arc flash incident. All trades represented. Distributed updated arc flash boundary labels. Ordered additional arc-rated PPE.

title: Heat Illness Prevention and Hydration
description: Covered heat stress index calculation and work-rest cycles. Reviewed symptoms of heat exhaustion vs heat stroke. Discussed acclimatization requirements for new and returning workers. Distributed hydration packs and electrolyte supplements.
notes: All field personnel required. Reviewed 2025 heat incidents. Updated water station locations for all projects. Established buddy system for extreme heat days.

title: Scaffolding Inspection and Use
description: Reviewed scaffold assembly standards and component inspection. Covered wind load considerations following Museum Park scaffold collapse incident. Discussed competent person inspection requirements and scaffold tagging system.
notes: All scaffold users and erectors. Updated wind speed monitoring protocol. New requirement: scaffolds secured at end of each shift for overnight wind events.

title: Forklift and Material Handling Safety
description: Comprehensive review following 2024 fatality at Port Terminal. Covered seatbelt requirements and interlock systems. Reviewed terrain assessment before operation. Discussed load capacity and stability triangle. Practiced pre-operation inspections.
notes: MANDATORY company-wide attendance. Emotional presentation from safety director. All forklift operators re-tested. New seatbelt interlock policy effective immediately.

title: Silica Dust Exposure Control
description: Reviewed OSHA silica rule Table 1 control methods. Covered wet cutting requirements for concrete and masonry. Demonstrated proper respirator fit testing and seal checks. Discussed exposure monitoring and medical surveillance requirements.
notes: All concrete cutting grinding and masonry crews. Verified all saw operators have current fit test cards. Ordered additional water suppression attachments for portable saws.

title: Emergency Action Plan and Evacuation Drill
description: Conducted full-scale evacuation drill across all Houston-area jobsites simultaneously. Timed assembly and headcount procedures. Tested emergency communication chain from field to office. Reviewed severe weather shelter locations.
notes: All employees company-wide. Evacuation times: Tower C 4min 20sec Resort 5min 45sec Port 3min 10sec. Two assembly point improvements identified.

title: Marine Safety and Over-Water Work
description: Covered requirements for work over water at Drake Waterfront marine bulkhead. Reviewed life vest requirements and rescue boat positioning. Discussed cold water immersion risks and rescue techniques. Practiced throw-ring deployment.
notes: All Drake Waterfront marine crew and support workers. Following safety inspection deficiency. Ordered additional rescue equipment. Assigned dedicated marine safety watch person.

title: Rigging and Load Handling
description: Reviewed sling capacity and angle factor calculations. Covered wire rope inspection criteria and rejection standards. Discussed multi-crane pick planning and communication requirements. Practiced load weight estimation exercise.
notes: All riggers crane operators and workers in crane operation zones. Updated load weight reference cards. Removed 4 questionable slings from service pending inspection.
